subject: Using JUnit to unit test a Doclet
msgSnippet: Hi all, I m a huge fan of JUnit and I ve been using it to test everything.  I think it s a great tool.  However, recently I ve run into a problem. I m
messageBody:
Hi all,

I'm a huge fan of JUnit and I've been using it to test
everything. I think it's a great tool. However, recently
I've run into a problem.

I'm currently writing a Javadoc Doclet and I want to
unit test it. But how should I go about doing this?

The Doclet is invoked by "javadoc -doclet MyDoclet Dummy.java".
Then it writes something to System.out based on the
javadoc content in Dummy.java.

I think if I want to test it, I'd need to get a
RootDoc reference somehow, but I'm not sure how.

Can anyone give me a hand? I'm using JDK 1.4
but the Doclet is targeted for 1.2/1.3/1.4.

Thanks.
